meanings.definition: Produced or arising from within an organism or system
meanings.sent1: The endogenously grown plants were healthier than the ones from outside.
meanings.sent2: The body's endogenously produced hormones regulate various functions.
meanings.sent3: It's like the body has its own secret recipe for endogenously creating energy.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity seemed to flow endogenously, like a hidden spring of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The endogenously developed software was far superior in performance.

meanings.sent1: The endogenously formed ideas were unique to her mind.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was due to its endogenously generated strategies.
meanings.sent3: His brain seemed to work endogenously, coming up with solutions out of the blue.
meanings.sent4: The endogenously sourced materials gave the product a distinct quality.
meanings.sent5: The endogenously created art pieces were truly one-of-a-kind.
